intro: Hieracium elisabethae, commonly known as the Elizabeth's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, preferring cool and moist environments. It produces yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are generally hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern. Hieracium elisabethae is often found in high-altitude areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
